headline: Is Royal Caribbean (RCL) Quietly Redefining Its Guest Economics With New Port and Beach Investments?
summary: Royal Caribbean Group and Miami-Dade leaders recently broke ground on the new Cruise Terminal G at PortMiami, a US$345 million LEED-designed facility set to handle up to 7,000 passengers and support Icon-class ships from late 2027. At the same time, Royal Caribbean opened its Royal Beach Club Paradise Island in Nassau, the first in a new portfolio of exclusive all-inclusive destinations that deepen the company’s control over the guest experience and its share of vacation spend. We’ll now...
